    The contect of the section isnt listed below the icon on the main page

    Hi
    I upgraded my atutor 1.6.1 which had been upgraded from 1.5.1. No errors were anounced while installing, and everything seems ok. now.
    The only problem is that when the new system is installed directly, the context of the sections such as File storage list their contexts (files, antthing in) just below the icon on the main page. But when I upraded it this can't be occur. You should click the
    icon to see the context.
    What should I do to see the context listed just below the icon of the section on the main page?
    I thought it could be be due to the version of default theme of the atutor. It looks as 1.5.x. But I couldn't change it.
    I need your help.



    If you are asking for help, provide lots of detail so problems can be reproduced.

    ATutor version - 1.6.3

  • 2009-10-23 12:34:51

    Re: The contect of the section isn't listed below the icon on the main page

    I'm guessing you're talking about the new detailed view for icons/tools on the course home page. You just need to click the toggle icon in the top left, as an instructor, to switch between icon view and detailed view.

    Also, test with the default theme. Perhaps Ice Blue is not working properly. It's not one of our themes.

  • 2009-11-18 09:12:36

    Re: The contect of the section isn't listed below the icon on the main page

    fazli, as an instructor of a course, you would need to click the toggle at the top left of the icons to switch between icon mode and detailed mode.

    If you are using a custom theme, it may need to be upgraded. see the theme changelog for details about upgrading a theme

    http://wiki.atutor.ca/display/atutorwiki/Themes+Change+Log

  • 2009-12-09 09:06:22

    Re: The contect of the section isn't listed below the icon on the main page

    It may be a problem with Pretty Url if you have it turned on in System Preferences. Turn it off and see if that helps.

    If you do not understand the theme changelog, then you probably need someone who is able to understand it to make changes to your custom theme. The changelog and theme development assumes the designer has at least basic HTML and CSS skills. And, a little knowledge of PHP helps.
